Title: High Spirit… Brown Joel’s bubbly take-off
Summary: The Ajegunle-born singer revisits his roots, his trio’s rise to fame . High Spirit is a 10-track debut mixtape that captures his buoyant mix of gratitude, faith, and youthful wonder .

Title: How Many States Are in Nigeria?
Summary: The question of how many states are in Nigeria might seem straightforward, but there’s actually quite a fascinating story behind the number . Whether you’re a student preparing for an exam, a curious citizen, or someone planning to visit every corner of Nigeria?

Title: NNPCL launches health insurance for retail attendants nationwide
Summary: The Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited has launched a health insurance scheme for service attendants across its petrol stations nationwide . In a statement signed by Chief Corporate Communications Officer, Andy Odeh, NNPCL said it decided to up the ante .

Title: PDP proceeds with convention, ignores court orders
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) proceeded with its National Elective Convention in Ibadan . The 10,000-capacity Adamasingba Stadium and adjoining areas were packed with delegates, officials and supporters from across the country .

Title: Ace artist Tobechi Achionye stages ‘Inclusive Runway for Kindness’ to mark World Kindness Day
Summary: Tobechi Achionye, a multi-talented autistic artist and runway model, also known as Kind Toby, has held the debut edition of the Inclusive Runway for Kindness show with children with special needs . The event is to mark the 2025 World Kindness Day .

Title: Turaki emerges new national chairman as PDP Ibadan convention holds amid court battles
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) defied multiple legal hurdles to hold its National Convention . Turaki emerges new national chairman as PDP Ibadan convention holds amid court battles . Several high-profile figures from the party's ranks were purged from its ranks .

Title: Forty-five days that changed elections in Africa?
Summary: An unlikely coincidence of ballots in a forty-five day period from the middle of September to the end of October 2025 has cast a new light on the state of democratic governance in Africa . The ritual hollowness of elections on the continent has become the fate of elections under the watch of the African Union and other regional institutions .

Title: There’s ongoing Christian genocide in Nigeria, PFN insists
Summary: Pentecostal Fellowship of Nigeria insists there’s ongoing ‘Christian genocide’ in Nigeria . Accuses the government of indifference and complicity in the face of persistent attacks on Christian communities .

Title: Oworonsoki demolitions: Sanwo-Olu reaffirms commitment to fairness as victims receive more compensation
Summary: Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu reaffirms commitment to fairness, transparency, and welfare of residents affected by demolition of environmentally unsafe buildings . Sanwo Ogunlesi assured that all displaced persons would be resettled and adequately compensated .

Title: Impeachment Tension in Ondo: 14 Lawmakers Back Speaker Oladiji
Summary: The Speaker of the Ondo State House of Assembly, Rt. Hon. Olamide Oladiji, has said that the 12 lawmakers calling for his impeachment were personal and not for the betterment of the state . This is coming as 14 lawmakers in the Assembly passed a vote of confidence in him .

Title: Things to know about PDP’s new national chairman, Kabiru Turaki
Summary: Northern stakeholders of the party convened in Abuja and endorsed Kabiru Taminu Turaki, SAN, as their consensus candidate for national chairman . The endorsement was announced at a high-profile gathering attended by key figures from across the North, including PDP governors, former Senate President, Bukola Saraki, and other senior party leaders

Title: 18 spots left as World Cup qualification race heats up in Europe, Africa
Summary: The battle for the remaining 18 spots for the 2026 FIFA World Cup is reaching a thrilling stage . Europe and Africa deliver high-stakes drama as teams fight to secure their place at next year’s global spectacle . Scotland slipped into danger after a 3-2 defeat to Greece, leaving them one point behind Denmark in Group C .

Title: Ex-minister Turaki emerges PDP national chairman
Summary: A former Minister of Special Duties and Intergovernmental Affairs, Kabiru Turaki, has been elected as the new National Chairman of the Peoples Democratic Party . Turaki ran unopposed after the party’s 2023 governorship candidate in Katsina State, Lado Danmarke, withdrew from the race . The positions of

Title: CAF clears Ndidi for final
Summary: The Super Eagles have confirmed that Wilfred Ndidi is eligible to play in Sunday’s 2026 FIFA World Cup playoff final against DR Congo .
